p: Whether vaccination can prevent asthma exacerbations is unclear. The Expert Panel Report concluded that influenza vaccine does not reduce the frequency or severity of asthma exacerbations during the influenza season ( 17). Many patients in the community with asthma experience severe complications from an influenza infection, so all reasonable means of prevention should still be taken, including vaccination. The influenza virus appears to be a less potent trigger of asthma than HRV, and influenza peaks are not as well correlated with childhood asthma peaks as in the case of HRV.
